Kristinn Sigurdsson wrote:

> Hey S�ren,
>  
> How did you add your policy to the crawler? Did you just drop in a JAR 
> file and edit the configuration manually? Unfortunately that doesn't 
> work. Assuming you are using the BdbFrontier, you'll need to edit 
> org.archive.crawler.frontier.AbstractFrontier where you need to add 
> your class name to the String 'queueStr' on line 260 (latest HEAD). 
> Obviously it would be better if Heritrix read this value from a 
> configuration file, but it doesn't so I'm afraid you will have to do 
> your edit and remake Heritrix. Perhaps better, you could rewrite the 
> class to read this from file and submit a patch.

Heyup Kris.  You might be a little bit off the mark in the above.  Line 
260 is giving you a chance to set config. via a properties file -- if in 
an obtuse way.  Line 260 is looking at system properties and only if 
nought found, does it use the provided list: 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/frontier/AbstractFrontier.html#260.  
System properties get populated from heritrix.properties by 
Heritrix#loadProperties:  See 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/Heritrix.html#752.  
Any properties that have a key that starts with 'org.archive.crawler' 
are added into system properties.  We find heritrix.properties by first 
looking to see if user has pointed us at alternate properties by passing 
a '-Dheritrix.properties=ALTERNATE' on command line using that if 
found.  Otherwise, we look to see if a conf dir in HERITRIX_HOME and if 
that contains a heritrix.properties.   Fallback is the 
heritrix.properties that gets built into the heritrix.jar (See 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/Heritrix.html#774).


S�ren wrote:

>     It is not clear to me, if the heritrix.properties is read anywhere
>     implicitly in our (as we don't use the Heritrix.java class, but
>     instead instantiate a CrawlController, and use this to crawl).
>     The Heritrix.java class seems to me the only class, which loads the
>     heritrix.properties.
>
Can you just call Heritrix#loadProperties before you instantiate your 
CrawlController soon after startup?  Its static.
